name: Windows Installer Package
summary: Learn about .MSI files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: MSI files are similar to .EXE files, in that both are used to install and launch Windows programs. However, EXE files do not always contain installers and may simply launch the program they contain when double-clicked. MSI files, on the other hand, always contain installers.
Windows uses the Windows Installer program to open MSI files. This program was previously named the Microsoft Installer, which is what gave MSI files their name.
NOTE: In Windows Vista, .MSU files are used to install system updates and hotfixes.

description: An MSI file is a Windows package that contains installation information for a particular installer, including files to be installed and installation locations. It may be used for Windows updates or third-party software installers.

instructions: In Windows, you can open an MSI file by double-clicking it. Doing so will allow you to install the Windows updates or program your MSI file contains.
Because MSI files are compressed archives, you can also decompress them to examine the files they contain. For example, you can use 7-Zip to decompress an MSI file and examine its contents.
